intro: Oxymeris inaequalifolia, commonly known as the unequal-leaved oxymeris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that vary in size and shape, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Oxymeris inaequalifolia is often found in open woodlands and savannas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
